title: Circular motion - objects speed falling from loop

content.question: Students experiment with a small marble sliding down a ramp into a vertical circular track of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The friction between the marble and the surface is negligible. At Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, the velocity of the marble is <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>, at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> above the horizontal. In one trial, the marble loses contact with the track at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. What is <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math>?
